pages.text: Ctenurella gladbachensis was a species of small ptychtodont placoderm that lived during the Late Devonian in what is now Germany. Its fossils were found in the Strunde valley, in the Paffrather Kalkmulde. While most ptychtodonts are thought to have fed on or near the seabed, the fins of Ctenurella suggest it may have also swum in open waters. Male Ctenurella could be distinguished from the females by the pair of hook-shaped claspers.
